text:
Importing and cleaning weather data for analysis.

title: Cleaning
text:

weather <- read_csv("data-original/weather.csv")

title: Cleaning
text:
Export
Exporting the cleaned data as rds.

write_rds(
  weather,
  "data-processed/01-weather-cleaned.rds"
)

title: Analysis
text: Analyzing Austin weather data, specifically temperature and precipitation.

title: Analysis
text: Analyzing Austin weather data, specifically temperature and precipitation.

title: Analysis
text:
Setup
Loading the libraries.

library(tidyverse)
library(janitor)

title: Analysis
text:
Days with most rain
Which days had the most rain, and how much rain are we talking about?

weather |>
  select(date, prcp) |>
  arrange(desc(prcp)) |>
  filter(prcp >= 5)

# A tibble: 8 × 2
  date        prcp
  <date>     <dbl>
1 2001-11-15  7.55
2 2010-09-07  7.04
3 1998-10-17  6.24
4 1994-08-09  5.68
5 1981-06-11  5.66
6 1979-05-21  5.55
7 2015-05-25  5.2 
8 2017-08-26  5.08


Data Takeaway: The heaviest rainfall days in Austin brought more than five inches of rain in a single day, with the highest reaching 7.55 inches on Nov. 15, 2001.

title: Analysis
text:
Hottest days
What are the hottest days in history?

weather |>
  select(date, tmax) |>
  arrange(desc(tmax)) |>
  head(10)

# A tibble: 10 × 2
   date        tmax
   <date>     <dbl>
 1 2000-09-05   112
 2 2011-08-28   112
 3 2000-09-04   110
 4 2003-08-08   110
 5 2011-08-27   110
 6 2018-07-23   110
 7 2022-07-10   110
 8 2023-08-17   110
 9 1954-07-26   109
10 2011-08-29   109


Data Takeaway: Austin’s hottest recorded temperature was 112 degrees, reached on Sept. 5, 2000, and Aug. 28, 2011. Multiple hot days occurred in 2011, appearing three times among the top 10 hottest days.

title: Analysis
text:
Coldest days
What are the coldest days in history?

weather |>
  select(date, tmin) |>
  arrange(tmin) |>
  head(10)

# A tibble: 10 × 2
   date        tmin
   <date>     <dbl>
 1 1949-01-31    -2
 2 1949-01-30     4
 3 1989-12-23     4
 4 1951-02-02     7
 5 2021-02-16     7
 6 2021-02-15     8
 7 1940-01-19    10
 8 1983-12-25    10
 9 1982-01-11    11
10 1940-01-23    12


Data Takeaway: The coldest days in Austin’s recorded history reached as low as -2 degrees on Jan. 31, 1949.

title: Analysis
Weather Data
text:
We will pull data from the “primary” weather station for downtown Austin, the Camp Mabry station, and complete various tasks with this data. You can find the downloadable data here.
This is the link to the cleaning notebook.
